SENT.plain: It is reported on a 6-year-old Middle European boy suffering from a nasopharynx tumor with involvement of a submandibular lymph node
The tumor was classified by morphologic, serologic and virologic data as a true or Epstein-Barr virus-associated Burkitt's lymphoma, resp., which has been, up to now, seldom seen outside Africa
The patient died 3 months after diagnosis
Autopsy has shown tumor involvement of nasopharynx and soft tissues in the left neck region, several lymph nodes, kidneys, liver, spleen, and bone marrow
Cytologic, light and electron microscopic data are reported and the structural change of the tumor is referred to
